entry.title: #CallToAction...
entry.content:
#CallToAction
HAPPENING NOW: Your mayor and council members are meeting to discuss the 2-year contract with #DenverPoliceDepartment that increases their budget in the second year. This budget increase allows for MORE funds devoted to the chemical weapons they terrorize our city with! They plan to quietly vote on it tomorrow 9/3 with only online public comment that they can control the narrative on with the click of a button. Contact your council member and Michael B. Hancock TODAY and let them know as their constituent you DEMAND they do not support the following:

‚ùåAny Collective Bargaining Agreement with DPD longer than 1 year.

‚ùåAny agreement that gives ANY financial increases or incentives to police.

‚ùåAny agreement that does not require police to be financially responsible for their attorneys and settlements in any cases of alleged excessive force or race related discrimination

#DEFUNDPOLICE #DEFENDBLACKLIFE

entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280Amplify the Voice was live.

#marchagainstracism and #PoliceViolence #amplifythevoice #denver #colorado
#FrontlinePartyforRevolutionaryAction (FPRA)
#PartyforSocialismandLiberation (PSL)
#...WallofMoms #ACAB #1000MilesforElijah ‚úäüèæ

Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Please join the Party for Socialism and Liberation and the Frontline Party for Revolutionary Action on August 30 for a march bringing together Denver and Aurora to demonstrate our unity and determination in the fight against racism and police violence. ***Attendees are invited to march on foot or in their cars.*** We will begin our march at the Martin Luther King Jr. Library in Aurora and march down Colfax to end at the Martin Luther King Jr. memorial at City Park in Denver.

Please stay tuned for opportunities to volunteer and otherwise support this event.

Let us not forget that we still need justice for:
Elijah McClain, murdered by Aurora Police at age 23
William Debose, murdered by Denver Police at age 21
Alexis Mendez-Perez, murdered by Colorado DOC at age 16
Jessie Cedillo, murdered by Pueblo Police at age 20
De‚ÄôVon Bailey, murdered by Colorado Springs Police at age 19
Paul Childs, murdered by Denver Police at age 15
Dion Damon, murdered by Denver Police at age 40
Michael Marshall, murdered by Denver Police at age 50
Jason Gomez, murdered by Denver Police at age 33
Jessie Hernandez, murdered by Denver Police at age 17
David Baker, murdered by Aurora Police at age 32
Marvin Booker, murdered by Denver Police at age 56
Paul Castaway, murdered by Denver Police at age 35
Ryan Ronquillo, murdered by Denver Police at age 20
Joseph Valverde, murdered by Denver Police at age 32
Odiceo Valencia-Lopez, murdered by Denver Police at age 45
Naeschylus Carter-Vinzant, murdered by Denver Police at age 37
Jeffrey Melvin Jr., murdered by Colorado Springs Police at age 27
James Elbert Young Jr., murdered by Denver Police
)

entry.title: When George Floyd was slowly murdered in the streets, Denver and...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

When George Floyd was slowly murdered in the streets, Denver and Aurora, like cities all across the country, saw themselves. Our communities too have long suffered under the knee of the racist police and white supremacy. We are now entering the third month of uprising, and demonstrations continue with no sign of stopping, demanding justice for the victims of the police in our own community and an end to all forms of racist violence.

The police and their racist backers are un...

entry.title: Some much needed good news!
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Some much needed good news!

A Denver city council committee approved a $700,000 loan to the Montbello Organizing Committee to acquire an old RTD bus station for a new cultural hub called Montbello FreshLo.

entry.title: We are so grateful for the many blessings and gifts this man...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

We are so grateful for the many blessings and gifts this man gave us in his art. The grief is truly immeasurable, but we take comfort in knowing his long, painful battle with cancer is over. Rest easy, brother.

Chadwick Boseman

It is with immeasurable grief that we confirm the passing of Chadwick Boseman.‚Å£
‚Å£
Chadwick was diagnosed with stage III colon cancer in 2016, and battled with i...t these last 4 years as it progressed to stage IV. ‚Å£
‚Å£
A true fighter, Chadwick persevered through it all, and brought you many of the films you have come to love so much. From Marshall to Da 5 Bloods, August Wilson‚Äôs Ma Rainey‚Äôs Black Bottom and several more, all were filmed during and between countless surgeries and chemotherapy. ‚Å£
‚Å£
It was the honor of his career to bring King T‚ÄôChalla to life in Black Panther. ‚Å£
‚Å£
He died in his home, with his wife and family by his side. ‚Å£
‚Å£
The family thanks you for your love and prayers, and asks that you continue to respect their privacy during this difficult time. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Photo Credit: Sam Jones

Black Lives Matter 5280Unicorn Riot

On the 57th anniversary of the iconic ‚ÄúI have a Dream‚Äù speech, an estimated 70,000-100,000 people have converged at the Lincoln Memorial to demand accountabilit...y for murders committed by police.

----
"We are here today to say that transforming our criminal justice system & purging it of mass incarceration & systemic racism is not negotiable."

"Our fight for racial justice is not negotiable." - Former Mayor of New Orleans & head of the The National Urban League, Marc Morial
----
"Today, we commemorate the #MarchOnWashington for jobs & freedom in 1963 where my father declared his 'dream' but we must never forget the American nightmare of racist violence exemplified when Emmitt Till was murdered on this day in 1955." - Martin Luther King III

entry.title: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching...
entry.content: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching and reading about any violence enacted on our friends and loved ones, pieces of ourselves, on the internet. We give thanks to the ancestors and higher power that guided #JacobBlake back to share more joyful moments with his children like the one in this picture we are intentionally sharing instead of that horrific video. Today we are reminded that it is an essential component of #Blackliberation to take pause and hold space for our whole selves —body, mind, and spirit. To choose healing. #Blackhealingisrevolutionary #BlackLivesMatter

entry.title: From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what...
entry.content:
From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what we celebrate today as #BlackAugust. Black August, first commemorated by our incarcerated brothers and sisters, is a time to recommit ourselves to the struggle for #BlackLiberation and to honor those who’ve contributed to our collective progress and all those who have been lost to unjust violence and systemic racism.
This August 21, join us in a car protest to bring the Black August fight to our local prison walls. We will drive in a mobile protest to the Denver County Jail and the GEO Aurora ICE detention facility to let those who are chained there know that we are with them, we are fighting for them, and we will keep fighting until all chains are broken.
The many injustices faced by those behind bars in the U.S. are today amplified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Prisons and jails all across the country, where medical neglect is commonplace and quarantining impossible, have become hotspots of infection. Hundreds have died in US prisons from COVID-19, and yet no response has been made to defend against unnecessary death. The mass incarceration of Black, Brown, and Indigenous populations means that they are not only disproportionately affected by the virus outside of jail, but inside as well.
We raise the following demands, recognizing that if they are not met, more unnecessary death is a certainty:
1. Immediate humanitarian release of all ICE detainees and all vulnerable inmates, those convicted for non-violent offenses, and those who have not been convicted at all.
2. Where people remain behind bars, drastically increase medical staffing and supplies to local jails and state prisons, and guarantee sanitary conditions for all inmates.
3. Free all political prisoners!
#FreeThemAll #DecarcerateNOW #decarcerateCOVID19

entry.title: ‚ñ∂
Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
